column11: Review Text

Great beach clean gently sloping beach into sea great shore breaks for body surfing We ate lunch and supper at Best Beach Bar Restaurant delicious fresh food Adults and kids really having fun great atmosphere

column8: Very nice, tidy beach area with a number of small restaurants.
column11: Beautiful, flat sloping beach to the sea, which seems very clean and tidy. In/at the small restaurants on the beach there is a very relaxed atmosphere. Nobody became intrusive, everything ‚Äúlazy‚Äù, just beautiful, just like before. We stay at Anantara Peace Haven Tangalle, which also has a phenomenal beach next door in its hotel property, but slopes slightly steeper to the sea. Both are wonderful to look at and suitable for swimming and/or romping with the waves, depending on the state of the tide. Visually a great pleasure.

We stayed at the Anatara Peace Haven next door, and wondered over to this beach a few times.  It's lovely to sit on the beach with a drink as the sun goes down, with the water lapping at your feet. Also, at the far East corner there is Eden Spa.  I visited Nirosha for a massage nearly every day.  She did wonders for my back, I highly recommend.  I have had massages all over the world, and her massage was definitely one of the best.

column8: Tangalle Beach is a beautiful, unspoiled beach in Sri Lanka with golden sands and clear waters. It's great for sunbathing, swimm
column11: Tangalle Beach in Sri Lanka is a beautiful stretch of coastline with golden sands and clear turquoise waters. It's a popular destination for sunbathers, swimmers, and surfers alike. While the waves can be rough at times, there are calmer areas for swimming. The beach is also known for its stunning sunsets and laid-back atmosphere.

The beach would have a great potential pity for the incivility that reigns supreme given the neglect and degradation with huge amounts of rubbish not only on the margins of various reviews but also on the rocks, as well as a really excessive amount of plastic floating in the sea. Unfortunately the plastic here seems that no one sees it... now it is part of the environment (irreversibly destroyed)
Go to the Yuliconia beach restaurant‚Ä¶.do not be put off by its image‚Ä¶THE FOOD IS AMAZING‚Ä¶.THE DEVIL CALAMARI IS OFF THE SCALE

column8: Good beach with high waves. Definitely worth the experience
column11: Small delicious beach. There are quite wild waves, but you can easily swim there and throw yourself into the waves. You may use sunbeds on the beach in exchange for buying something in the bars. At the Yellow Mellow bar, you may even be allowed to borrow body boards for free to throw yourself onto the big waves. But remember‚Ä¶. They are quite powerful at times.

My family and I really liked the Anantara Hotel.  Friendly and helpful staff, beautiful hotel grounds, excellent service.  I would especially like to highlight employee Anthony, who helped us very quickly and efficiently in resolving our questions and wishes.

column8: Great beach - I recommend it to everyone
column11: Very nice beach. Clean sand, not even a hint of garbage. There are many good eateries and bars on the beach. There are a couple of very decent seafood restaurants, and if you don‚Äôt like spicy Sri Lankan cuisine, you can ask for the dish to be less spicy
This is a very good tour guide in Tangalle Goyambokka area. He know what we need to do. He know all the places around the area
Superb beach located alongside Hiriketiya road. It's a bit of a rocky beach and an ideal place to relax. It has a bit of rough waves during certain parts of the year but I don't think it's dangerous.
This is a very nice small restaurant. Fantastic beach and Mr. Ruvan and his team show you their great hospitality. They get my beat recommendations.

A beautiful beach near Tangalle with a few places to eat and drink. You can rent sun loungers here and it‚Äôs often free if you buy drinks or eat. If not, it‚Äôs around 1000 rupees. Tip‚Ä¶wherever you rent the lounger from is where you are expected to order food and drinks from. The waves are deceptively high so be careful! There isn‚Äôt a lifeguard but the bar owners are helpful and friendly. One bar doesn‚Äôt have a food menu - the food is that fresh as it‚Äôs whatever they catch! The dogs won‚Äôt bother you, they may sit under your lounger or the umbrella to keep cool. This was a favourite part of our holiday.

If you find a sunglasses P.Y.E. Please let me know, I have lost it today 22bd March in waves at Goyambokka beach It‚Äôs a lovely and beautiful quite beach. Also recommend rest Eden Reverie, they have sun beds and nice kitchen. Instagram: gewawa
A nice, peaceful beach, few beach restaurants, some sun loungers. Lovely place to relax by the coconut palms, clean sand, and sparkling shore

The beach is divine. It is about 200 metres long with soft off white sand and rolling swell. We went during the covid crisis so the beach was really quiet. The bars and restaurants that were once open were all closed down. We loved it here and found it very relaxing. It is a good idea to take snacks and refreshments with you.
Excellent beach! Waves are not so big as on another beaches in Tangalle, many restaurants, cheap sunbeds

Came back here for the second year as this is my favourite beach in the world. Although the waves are powerful the natural breakwaters lead to a wash that reaches 20 metres so everyone can get in. Swim further out and you have regular 3 m waves. Great fun. The beach bars, particularly Bamboo do juice, food and beer. I‚Äôve travelled to Thailand, Malaysia, Africa and other countries and I love this beach. Perfect sand. The deserted beach at Rekawa is lovely but you cannot swim due to the rip-tides.

Small but nice beach. Do not expect swimming. Just be in the water, because of high waves. For our 2 years old child dangerous, but manageable with an adult. Benches for free if you get a drink. I recommend this place.

We were staying at the attached resort so naturally we spent a lot of time on this beach. It‚Äôs a small but quiet beach that we found fun to swim in. The water is a bit rough but easy to get in and out. Very fun if you have a boogie board. Only drawback were the local vendors set up here. It‚Äôs nice that they are there to serve cold beer (500 standard price) and provide a lounge chair and shaded place to sit. But the constant pushing for you to buy something, or fighting for your service is a turn off. The only vendor I found to not hustle you is to the very far right when you first enter the beach(faceing the ocean.) They seem to be the ‚Äúnew guys‚Äù on the beach and it shows.

Excellent Beach with safe bathing and with supervised child friendly waves. Nice beach restaurants for refreshments and food to choose from. Even over Christmas and New Year not too busy.. Mainly because it's not accessible by tourist busses.
Lovely beach but being small was overly crowded for us, maybe others like that. Otherwise looks the part
Cozy beach with clear waters and great restaurants for lunch. You get the sunbed for free if you eat there

Lovely bay with a few restaurants who provide long chairs if you eat or drink at their property. Nice soft sand beach with wave but shallow at the beginning so you can actually enjoy the water. Bot too busy so very enjoyable. No vendors.

Because when we went it was windy and the waves were really big. Not ideal for swimming or snorkeling. A few small restaurants were open but dont go the one called Phoenix, right where the river flows into the ocean. I found a piece of metal in my food and the owner seemed not to care, but offered a 35 rupee discount, pretty ridiculously for something that could have seriously harmed me.
Loved this beach . We had an unforgettable times with our children . Beach huts are not reliable for main meals . Ok for a beer !
Really good beach, one of the few that you can enjoy the water with its low shelf Unlike the steep offshore shelf in the next door resort
This is  a good beach to sunbathe. The waves are strong and big. Sea bath not possible due windy conditions.
Good beach, amazing waves (to swim in not surf!), not too crowded and nice bar with friendly staff. Worth an afternoon to relax or swim.
This spot very popular with tourists offers a good safe spot to enjoy the warm waters, and also for relaxation on the white warm sand.

Good beach to relax, beautiful cenary, the sea had small waves, good for kids. There are small restaurants on the beach but it's not to crowded.. normally if you lunch there you have hammocks for free and that's a good plan.
Nice to come across a beach without much litter,nice and quiet with a number of seafood restaurants.
Clean and simple. A few restaurants and a spa where you can get a massage. Very cute puppies if you go soon!
Very good calm beach. not more crowded. nice restaurants on the beach. Very Easy to locate. and easy to take the transport to the city and it is not much expensive.

The only way to get to this small but secluded beach is via a tuk-tuk or a scooter. My friend and I took the latter mode of transport and throughly enjoyed the experience of sipping beer while savouring the picturesque view...
Goyambokka beach is very nice, a little bay with several small beach bars, restaurants. Not crowded at all, very relaxing. Very clean. Sea can be rough some time but all fine.

The beach is a small bay with almost white sand and no unpleasent rocks. You can use parasols and lounge beds from the little restaurants if you buy a drink or food from them. All very reasonably prices. Water has nice temperatuur but under current is strong. In short, very nice beach.
The beach is stunning. The waves are quite big so ideal if you want to surf. Some of the restaurants on the beach are nice however some can be quite rude.

We went to this beach as part of our stay in Tangalle. Having first been to Silent Beach which is a 15 minute walk up along the coast from here it was great to find a beach with a bit more going on (bars, restaurants etc.). Silent Beach was definitely quieter which was where we had lunch, however the waves were dangerously high when we were there so were glad to find a beach we were more comfortable about swimming in. The scenery is beautiful here and there are so many options for food, drinks and even a Spa if you want a massage here.
I really love this beach because is quiet, it has waves so you can be in the ocean for a really long time. You have a lot of restaurant options and you can stay here all day long if you want to.
A bit of a trek off the main road but this beach is beautiful! There are several restaurants on the beach so you can easily spend a day here. If you order food then you get to use the sunbeds

This is a very pretty beach, but you won't have it to yourself, as there are many resorts and guest houses within walking distance. Swimming is possible but can be a rough sea. Definitely not for small children. There are a half dozen restaurants advertising fresh seafood scattered along the beach and a massage shop at the east end. Boogie boards for rent as well. A little exploration will reveal a small, more private beach past some rocks to the west. A pleasant place to hang out for the day.

Spent a couple of days on this beach. Waves built up during both days and were dumping by afternoon. Water was clean and beach has 4 or 5 beach restaurants. The one immediately to the right as you enter from the fenced forest path has a toilet but no wifi. it has shady spots towards the back. Spa at the other end is expensive. Around the western point is a small restaurant with a couple of amazing rooms to rent on the point.

Loads of drinks, lunch and dinner beach on this beautiful golden bay with rock pools at each end. boogy boards available for hire, and free use of eatery lounge chairs when you order something. Pretty much the same view as Anantara Peace Haven next door but $3000 cheaper!
Small beach but nice. One small restaurant and a bar with a view of palm trees. Plus, the restaurant cooks delicious food. During our visit, the beach wasn¬¥t crowded but neither we were alone there.

Wonderful beach for both sunbathing and swimming. Water is waist/ chest deep for 75-100m and very good waves to enjoy. Also good places for body surfing - some of the beach side shacks offer boards for rent. Good place for families to enjoy.
The beach is beautiful with nice small waves, sunbeds, few restaurants and massage place. One of the best beaches in tangalle for swimming!

Do not use the sun loungers at Greetje restaurant. I had been using one fully prepared to buy lunch and drinks when I was rudely told to move sun loungers to make way for a group of three other tourists. There were no others available. Nice beach but the Cabanas and restaurants here are low standard for Sri Lanka.

Wonderful beach. Great food. Beautiful scenery. Great to go with kids. Going in the water is great fun as the waves are moderately big. Only concern is the current as little kids can easily be swept away. Peaceful and calm atmosphere. Will definitely return. :-)

The small main beach is cute, but there are some big hotels so it is crowded. A couple of simple but quite expensive restaurants. There are much nicer and wider (and empty!) beaches on the other side of Tangalle town.
We were staying around the corner at Anantara, but the beach there is so steep the waves were real dumpers. We just walked around the point to this beach for a lovely ocean swim.

Tricky to get to, but nice sand and water although be aware of conditions like rips. Plenty of places nearby offering food and drinks and sunbeds for free with a purchase (careful of which of those you choose). Toilet facilities lacking

We stayed at Plam Paradise Vilas on this beach. The beach is beautiful, but we were there in early October when the seas are still a bit rough. (We were told the surf and currents calm down in November for the busy season). Being from Australia and living near the beach we were able to swim, but the the waves were a strong shore dumps and behind the waves curents were very strong. So just be careful at this time of year when swimming. We would have loved to see the beach when it was calmer. A really pretty place.

It was a bit tricky swimming in the beaches in the main stretch in Tangalle, so my brother and I decideed to try out Goyambokka. The beach is a kind of tucked away cove surrounded by coconut trees and with a few restaurants behind the sand. The beach is very small, but as it was low season there were very few tourists so it felt very secluded and tranquil. The swimming was much better than in Tangalle, as although there are some strong waves they are not quite as strong as on the main stretch of Tangalle and water is fairly shallow. That being said, we still weren‚Äôt able to properly swim, more just wade in and jump about a bit, as the water is too shallow for proper swimming and if you go too far out you go beyond the surf where it is probably a bit dangerous. Also be aware there is still a rip tide of sorts, so keep a close eye on children if you have them. The restaurants did not seem to have elecricity as all the food and drink was stores in coolers, also meaning the range of options were limited. However, you can get noodles, rice, various more Wearern dishes if you want. We got a spiced grilled fish with chips which was delicious. *How to get there* Most of the tourists there seemed to be staying in one of the Cabanas next to the beach, however we were coming in from Tangalle town. We took a bus from the terrapin pond which is close to the base hospital and girls school. Not sure which bus, we just stood on the side of the pond (photo attached) and asked for Goyambokka and eventually a bus driver let us on, cost 20 rupees each. Just beware the buses were very busy and because it is a short distance, about 4 to 5 minutes, a fair few buses would not let us on. We then asked the conductor to let us know when we were at Goyambokka and he told us when. We also walked once, just along the road and that took us about 45 mins, but it is not ideal. A tuk tuk on another occasion cost us 250 rupees which is likely an extortionate tourist price but there you go. I‚Äôd recommend this beach for a more secluded experience and if you are happy to just sunbathe and have the occasional dip in the water, as there is nothing else there.
Some people‚Äôs angry with you because she have a all option. So sad ‚ÄúGreetje‚Äù I wish your future Rebuild again.sea you later
we stayed near here and visited only to be a little underwhelmed.  it wasnt that great and whilst it provided a little alk on a new bit of sand, there are better beaches in the area
Worth a visit - not the prettiest of beaches but absolutely wonderful for jumping in the waves and enjoying the Indian Ocean.
A realy nice beach with sometimes big waves. They come from behind, front and the left. Our youngest is 6 and I had to hold her cause the current is quite strong. Use your head and you ll be safe....

We were truly lucky enough to call here for a Sunday morning drink. It was early morning and not many people on the beach. Just to sit here and soak up the truly stunning scenery here and watch the world (or the waves!) go by. Truly breathtaking.
Beatiful place, we were there in low season and there is'nt lot of people. Blue sea and big waves - but it was doable üòÉ
Beautiful beach, just out of the main town well worth a visit. The waves and currents are strong. I would only advise competent swimmers to get out their depth.
This was an amazing beach. We enjoyed every bit of the time we spent here. Locals are friendly and its very safe. More than anything beach is one of the best I have ever been to.

We were here in April and it was very quiet. There are a few beds an the beach that are free to use if you have lunch and the restaurant that owns them. The beach itself is just beautiful in a little bay between two sets of rocks. The Anantara hotel is right next to it. The waves were very large and swimming was only safe for good swimmers. Take care with children.
clean beach, lovely little restaurants, good food, not too far for the many hotels and guesthouses. Easy drive with a Tuk-Tuk.

Very nice and quiet beach with a few restaurants. We preferred it to the Tangalle main beach. Restaurant owners asked 1500 Rupie from us to use the sunbeds, which is insane. We didn‚Äôt support that kind of rip off and just put our stuff on the ground.

After spending a few days on the crowded beach in Mirissa, we were delighted to find Goyambokka Beach. It had the right level of activity for us - a few restaurants, people around, but very tranquil. There were also lots of sun loungers free, which we didn't have to pay to use. The beach itself was very clean and well maintained. Would recommend if you want a peaceful day  by the ocean.

It's a busy place by standards of the region. But if you don't mind a bit of the crowd, then it's a great place to get a chair and enjoy the beautiful beach. Chairs seem to cost 1000 Rupees for two. Or you can eat a seafood lunch and your chair is free. The seafood lunch seemed to be dramatically overpriced to offset it though. We chose to just pay for the chair, which seemed fair.

This was my favourite out of several beautiful beaches along the coast between Tangalle and Galle. Mainly because it was not crowded. There are a few places to eat and the food was basic but good.The one I ate at gave you the sunbed all day for free if you agreed to eat there at lunch. People have commented that it's expensive. Well you'll find that after travelling the non-beach areas of Sri Lanka, suddenly EVERYTHING in this stretch is double or triple the price you've been paying e.g curry and rice I'd usually had for 300 now cost 1000.

We spent a few weeks travelling around Sri Lanka and this was one of our favourite beaches, It's not a massive beach but has a chilled vibe and isn't as busy as many of the other beaches we visited. The sea can have big waves but not enough to deter swimming. There are a few nice seafood restaurants along the beach not cheap but pretty standard prices. If your looking for somewhere to switch off and get away for a while I would highly recommend this place.

Nice, big waves, strong current. 3 places to buy sunbeds and food. Overpriced though. Stay away from food if You can. It is pricy and in low quality - especially the first You at the beach. Not the best beach for small children - go to Mangrove Beach instead..

This was one of the most amazing beaches we've been at. Beautiful white sand, warm ocean, nice bars and restaurants, wonderful vegetation and interesting fauna. Probably one of the best places in the world to relax!

It is hard to consider the impact of the Tsunami on this area when you see a beach this beautiful. There are some remnants - boats thrown up beyond the beach, but you wouldn't know. I was there midday, on Independence day, and it was still not crowded. The waves mean it is not great for swimming/snorkelling, but they make it attractive and a "washing machine ride" for swimming! There are numerous places to eat along the beach - so plenty of healthy competition. Worth a visit.

Stayed an afternoon at the beach. It id nice and clean with fine sand. The waves can be a bit rough. Several restaurants on the beach. They offer free sunchairs if you buy lunch , but lunch is quite expensive
Great beach, great waves (mind the kids).  Beach bars offer great lunches, cool drinks and sun loungers.  best beach i saw during my time in SL

We got there by moped and ended up beyond the east end of the beach, round a corner on a small beach with no one else there. So peaceful. Saying that the when you're in the water it's quite rocky and lots of urchins. Swam round to the main beach, which is much better for swimming and playing in the waves, although busier. Very clean and outstanding sandy beach. Beach shelves quite quickly, with some strong waves. No surfers as just a beach break. We ate at a small restaurant at the hidden beach. Canoe fishing boat came in, fisherman jumped out, boat hauled up, fish prepared and we ate lunch - can't get much fresher!

Ive stayed at palm paradise twice now which is attached to the beach and it really is beautiful.There are a couple of bars on the beach you can get a cold beer and plenty of rocks to explore for sea creatures. The sea is clear and warm and lots of big waves for the kids to play about in. I could literally get my daughter out of the sea for the whole time I was here
Really nice beach with plenty of sunbeds if you need it. I love big waves to play in (I'm soon to be 27 but you're never to old to have fun). Not really crowded so you have space to move around.

We spent a day hear- swimming in the beautiful sea, sunbathing, reading in the shade and enjoying some RR. We lay on sun loungers and were shaded by a parasol belonging to one of the restaurants on the beach, and had lunch there. The beach is quiet and beautiful.

My friends and I came here for the day. It is located off the main road and down a small path, so it is quite secluded. There are several small restaurants on the beach, but just be aware that you must leave the beach to find restrooms. The waves are big and rough, but the beach is absolutely beautiful.
We stayed just up the laneway from the beach with two kids under 12.  The beach was a lot of fun for the boys and the eateries along the beach were simple but very enjoyable.
Highly recommend if you want to escape the rush of Tangelle. It is connected to two other beaches, has a nice massage parlour at one end and a possible boating trip option at the other.
Decent spot with beach beds and 4-5 shacks. Not very busy which is always good. Service takes time. No washrooms apparently!
So chill and relaxing. This beautiful beach is a thing of my dreams. There are also a few restaurants and a spa ready to serve.

Read some reviews that said this beach was a bit of a tourist trap but we found it easy going and clean. Good to swim in but you need to be careful as the waves can be large and the rip strong (just take care).
Very nice beach and not crowded. There are lots of bars there who cooks delicious food and juices and beers. Recommended for relax !

Lovely quiet beach with a number of beach bars. We went into Greetje Beach Restaurant (it is the one with blue painted fence) I can not recommend the prawns enough, they are spicy, which includes a small amount of chilli, garlicky & cooked in butter. I always ordered the 250g prawns from the section of menu attached. Unfortunately I can‚Äôt comment on the rest of the menu as once I tried these I had them every time! Enjoy.
Stay on the quiet beaches with no one around and talk to the local fishermen. Or you could come here and feel like your in benidorm!
Definitely worth a visit - beautiful little bay with lovely seafood restaurant. Nice sands and clear water with good waves for body board hire.

I have no idea why is this place recommended so much.  Many sheds and dogs, beach is very narrow so there is no space to lay but on loungers. Maybe sandy ground of the ocean is enough for most people...

This was one of the best beaches in Tangalle (only Silence beach was better). We were here in September in low season and had the beach almost to ourselves! They have a swing you can have fun with, which was very cool. The sand and water was amazing. A bit high waves so you could not swim far out. They have a restaurant with good and cheap food, also drinks. Would recommend to visit this beach if you ever go to Tangalle.

When we visited, the high tight had eaten almost all the beach away that there was hardly even space to put a beach bed down. Also the wooden shacks on the beach sell their fish at one of the priciest I have seen for similar shacks ( 1300 Rupee for a simple grilled fish ) Maybe we were unlucky, But there are much nicer beaches around.
I stayed with my girlfriend at the Think Club Restaurant which has a villa literally on the sea on the point of Goyambokka beach. It is a stunning little beach
Very nice beach but be prepared for big waves so it is not for childrens and you almost cannot swim but you can Enjoy on waves

Such a quiet and beautiful beach. Very close to our homestay . There is a few small cafes that cater for most. Not that good for swimming as the waves were a bit rough but still had a great day, as we hired body boards and made the most of the waves.

We stayed in Tangalle, but because there we no good places to find where you could relax on a bed, we decided to go to Goyambokka Beach. It was very great, with sunbeds and places you could grab a lunch or some refreshing drinks. The waves were a bit high, but it was still good. In Tangalle we found a beach where the waves were quiet, but it was so full of locals and the local women arent allowed to wear swimming clothes, I felt very uncomfortable there in a bikini. In Goyambokka there are enough tourists to make you feel comfortable, but not enough to make the place feel too crowded.

A lovely alternative to some of the larger beaches in the area. I have to say though that some of the pictures are not of the beach in question. The beach is rather small and rocky at each end, the water is very clear and the tide was quite strong when we went. It is a little off the beaten track I'd say at least a 15 minute brisk walk from the road to get here. Quite a few locals here we noticed - it was nice
Picturesque place with high waves. There are small cafes with seafood. All the beach belongs to PPC.

Beautiful idyllic tropical beach, quite private as only two hotels back onto it. There are a few beach shacks selling food and drink, we ate at all of them and the food was great and the staff were super friendly. We did go in the sea but the waves are very strong so you need to be careful not to go out too far. We went at the end of tourist season so I'm not sure if it's a lot busier during the tourist months.
Fantastic beach and lovely for body boarding. It's a beach much safer for the tourist in terms of ambience, local people and also current in the water is not bad.
i felt like paradice when i entare to the beach. . good to swim. normally in april find rough waves here not big waves. nice beach.
Lovely beach, not too busy and chilled. Really enjoyed that it was far from the road so you could really relax. High waves in April so bit difficult to swim

Spent a day here cycled from Tangalle. The beach is nice a couple of accommodations back onto it. Last week of April there was a couple of the beach bars still open. As they are right on the beach and in the elements some of the beds etc were needing to be disposed of or repaired but guess they are waiting until the new season. For a quieter and just as nice beach 1km further out of Tangalle is Amanwella which we preferred (but nowhere for food so take water!)

The water is great for body surfing.  You can lay out on the many shaded lounge chairs with a fresh young coconut from any of the restaurant shacks along the beach.  There were a few amount of people, but definitely way less crowded, and smaller than Mirissa Beach.

There is no doubt that this beach is picture perfect to look at. Small, sandy cove fringed with palm trees. However, we stayed here for 2 weeks and on only one day was the surf reasonable. All other days there were huge dumping waves with a very strong undertow. This churned up the sand so the water was not pleasant. We found the food at the beach huts to be mediocre at best and certainly not value for money.

It's a beautiful beach - small and relatively quiet. Surprisingly good food in the beach shacks. But careful of the waves. You can have fun but we had to be in the water with our 8 & 11 year olds to keep an eye on them. Swimming is impossible unless you are a strong swimmer.

Stayed at the Whispering House with our family with a short walk to the beautiful beach. There can be some pretty powerful waves with a very strong undertow ‚Äî perfect for our 12yo and his dad. Our 10yo daughter would join in occasionally and our 6yo was perfectly happy to play in the sand and lighter surf. Her younger cousins were there (2 & 3yo), and they stayed in their life jackets enjoying the surf and sand. If you eat/order drinks at one of the beach shacks, you get a lounge with shade at no cost. Our usual spot was at the Krishan fish place. Best French fries ever and excellent food all the way round. Very fresh.

Gyombokka is a lovely horseshoe beach of the tropical paradise ilk. It remains fairly low key with 3 or 4 beach hut restaurants that fringe the sands and you can grab some lunch or a beer. The sea can get rough but is definitely swimmable if you know what you are doing. The hut owners charge you Rs 500 to rent a beach bed which is mildly annoying. Otherwise a great spot with a nice vibe.
Rustic and less touristy than other beaches in Sri Lanka. Great for couples! Hire a couple of sun beds with shade to keep you out of the tropical sun well worth it!

This beach is a little slice of paradise. White sands and clear water in a small bay fringed with palm trees. I loved the fact it wasn't too big, it only had a few bars/ eating places and wasn't over crowed with tourists. Moreover, if you take a little walk past the hut there's another little bay called fishermans bay which is so picturesque. You can't swim in the sea as it's too rocky but it would be great for snorkelling and it's very quiet. Being very much into photography the appearance was very important and I was able to take some great photos on this beach as it was so pretty, so it gets the seal of approval from me for that reason alone. I loved it here xo

This beach is very crowded and quite small. There are much better beaches all along the coast from Dikwella to Rekawa. Not sure what the hype is about.. it's packed with hotel tourists and I didn't like it.. lonely planet should definitely update their info..
the hidden beach (next bay, to the west side) is much nicer though you cannot swim there, but only switch the beaches for a swim!

We were lucky enough not to be housed in the main Tangalle beach resorts but rather in one of the quiet and cheap guesthouses of Unakuruwa bay, so Goyambokka beach felt (a bit more) crowded and expensive compared to the rest of our Sri Lankan trip. All the restaurants are extremely expensive (1200 rps for ROTI, about 50* the normal price), a good option was guesthouse Rocky point (up the stairs on the southwest creek), which has nice curries and juices on a lovely terrace for a break in the shade. They have sun beds on the beach as well. The beach itself is very beautiful and with beautiful big waves, (a few local residents have warned us off swimming) but Silent beach next door has all the views, a wider sand shore and none of the crowds (ask pathway to residents as it can be tricky to find on the beach side, given that a hotel has privetized some of the paths, or use the main road).
this beach is very different from other beaches in Tangalle. It's a small golf and very private/ there are some resorts there looking fantastic
the views are ok, but the beach is short, sunbeds are expensive, restaurants are poor. beware of "beach view restaurant" - worst food we have tried in sri lanka, moreover it was expensive

Some days there are huge waves, but they are so far out, that you can swim anyway, even with small children. The children thinks it¬¥s great fun to play in the waves. The sun beds can be quite expensive (1000 rupees each) if you dont buy sea food.

This is one of the most beautiful beach we have yet to have seen in Sri Lanka .definetly worth a 2 day visit. If it is nothing you want to do this is the right place.all of the beach caf√©s have the same price except when you walk a little through the rocks( right side) you will come across with Think restaurant. Wonderful people and wonderful place.must visit.

This was the BEST seafood we ate in Sri Lanka! It may look unassuming but the food was seriously delicious. Possibly the best grilled prawns I've ever had and my boyfriend's devilled calamari was equally awesome. Just delicious. I want to eat here everyday, forever. Beach was sublime too.
Beautiful place, really impressive, a hidden gem! You can stay at Rocky Point, which is a simple but well located b&b.

We ( family of 4 with 2 teens ) have just spent 3 days before moving onto Mirissa, this beach is beautiful with good waves and clean. There are 4 / 5 beach shacks here, we thought over priced for what they can serve. We were told no tea or coffee, no toilets and no where to wash your hands. I wonder what the chef does but no taking away from the fact the beach is beautiful, we were lucky our hotel 2 mins in tuk tuk away or a 10 mins walk to go toilet.

Smallish beach, but beautiful and very relaxed. We spent four days here and it was perfect. Sea is not too rough to mess about in, but not suitable for swimming. Sri Lanka has a lot of dogs, and there are quite a few here. They don't bother you, but one lady near us was playing with one and was playfully bitten. I would definitely have rabies jabs if going back to Sri Lanka.

We visited the beach during Ferbuary (in this time the sea should be calm). Beach is beatiful for watching and enjoying the wild nature. If you would like to enjoy swimmingin the sea, I can't recomend you. If you are not good experienced swimmer! Seriously be careful. I was swimming with my boyfriend in the waves and in the beginning it was ok. To swim over or under the waves seemed funny, but later really huge waves came and if I wouldn't be there with my boyfriend I wouldn't get out maybe. Sri Lanka has 3 drawn people per day, be careful guys üòÉ
Gorgeous beach.dont miss out Take a tuk and go just before sunrise. Don't forget to take a bottle of bear

Amazing beach. Not too many people, and easy to get sunbeds. Small restaurants serves fish and simple but very tastefull meals. The water is not too deep which is good for kids, but waves was a bit rought sometimes.

My version of paradise...water warm, waves big enough to play in but not as dangerous (according to locals who advised us) as other beaches in the area.  The surf was too rough for our younger child but our son had a good time.

Clear water and clean sand. Beautiful scenery and a couple of beach bars made this a place to enjoy for a couple of hours while sipping a lime soda that only cost ¬£1. It was fairly busy even though it was a quiet time of year. Most of the loungers and umbrellas were taken but we found shade from a tree. Definitely a beach to visit.
The beach is perfect for swimming children to play in the waves and on the sand. There are a few beach bars to satisfy thirsty and hungry

It's a 10 - 15 minute auto ride from Tangalle. It cost us 200 LKR. It's 3 mins away from main road, so take the tuktuk drivers mobile and call him for a ride back. The beach has 4 shacks, beds, sheds. The shacks offer decent food and drinks. It's scenic, so do wander around the end of the beach. Sea is rough at times, but that is usual in Srilanka. Downside - does not have a public restroom, not even the shacks. Sometimes there are small sharp rocks in the beach. Small but possible chance of cuts and bruises. My friends toe end got cut.
Wonderful beach with nice beach restaurants with fantastic sea food. The massage hut at the corner of the beach offered nice massage treatment in a wonderful frame of sound of the waves.

Goyamboka beach is by far the most beautiful beach that we have seen in Sri Lanka! Unfortunately we just stopped there on our way from unawatuna to tissa but next time this is definitely the place we will choose for a beach stop!!
this is one of the good choice of our selection. friendly and helpful staff. nice beach to relax with the kids. safe.
Nice local beach. The waves here are pretty high but when you accompany your child the sea is much fun.
Beautiful beach, clear water and it's not crazy busy. There aren't a tonne of restaurants so the palm trees are still lining it. Gorgeous!
Sunbed 500rs!! Wtf. Lovely to swim and relax but bring your own blanket because those totally overpriced sunbeds.

Very good beach, clear water, good (green) surfing waves. The restaurants are rather simple, not sure I would eat there. For surfing it can be a bit crowed so better to come early morning for that. You can rent surf boards at low rates.
Not very crowded but  with the possibility to have some food and drinks. Clean, realaxing and quiet! üëç
Great surf, always a Tuk Tuk on hand to pick up or drop you there - quiet beach, family friendly with food and drinks available nearby

We spent a couple of days at this beach and loved it . The water was a perfect temperature and was safe for swimming The restaurant at the west end of the beach served excellent if pricey sea food . The spa at the east end is over priced and not value for money . We thought we had booked a female masseuse to find a we had  a male therapist .

Very nice beach. Several other beaches in the area also have paradise views. This one is fairly easy to access, has several beach shacks to get food or drinks, and is good for children and it is protected from big waves and the water is shallow for a good distance. The drawback is that it is not as pristine as other beaches we you see nobody at all.

This is a very beautiful beach located near Tangalle. You could visit it with TukTuk or by foots. There are situated few restaraunts and some beds. For use of beds you should order some dinner at restaraunts. Another beautifully beach (Amanwella) situated not far from this place.
If you are not into the busy, touristy, music and bars of Mirissa and other places on the coast, this beach is an ideal little intimate beach with a gorgeous landscape.

I surely hope this treasure does not get spoiled by time and tourists. It is so uncrowded and lovely! We stayed very close by at the Green Garden Cabanas in walking distance and the breach was so beautiful, clean and uncrowded. My kids loved boogie boarding And there are places to rent on the beach. There are small restaurants as well, but honestly, it is a small beach with a chill attitude that makes you take it easy and just relax.
Nice chilled beach. A couple of restaurants/bars are there for cold beer or a mixed drink! It's great to spend your day and meet new people. Deff recommended !

Great place to hang out for a few hours or even an entire day. Lots of restaurants along the beach that sell cheap eats and beer/drinks. The beach is very active with waves and surf - perfect for boogie boards or body surfing.
This is an average beach.Only good for Walks.If you are closeby can go for walks Nothing much.No beach facilities.

Spent 4 nights here in December 2016. Beautiful beach and fairly good for swimming, but perhaps not for beginners as the waves can be rough at times. Didn't try the food at the restaurants, but just bought drinks as the sunbeds were then free to use for the whole day. Highly recommend the beach, but we had sleepless nights at the accommodation nearby (Goyambokka Guest House) because there are so many stray dogs that start barking and fighting at 5am! On our last night a religious sermon (on loudspeaker) from another property started at 3.45am and went on till 6am.
Probably the most untouched and the best beach in South Sri Lanka. Think Club has excellent seating and great food.

Lovely little cove, clean and nice for swimming. Shame about the restaurants and having to pay such high prices for the beach facilities plus every restaurant in the beach had exactly the same menu and prices which takes away from the character of the beach. If you are staying in Tangalle this place is slightly busier yet much cleaner - a must visit if you are in the area already, if you are on the move then head straight to Mirissa instead.
I went  it was realy nice  there is resteraunt on beach was clean   Would of stayed longer but had other beaches to visit

The waves here aren't 20 ft (like you see in Arugambay) but are abour 6 or 7 ft and are excellent to wrestle with. There are a few restaurants and cabanas which we didn't try. We went in late November so the beach wasn't completely deserted, but not too crowded too.  Worth checking out is the small lagooonish beach 1km before Goyambokka, where the waves aren't this wild so someone who isn't very confident in their swimming can still safely get in the water here.
this is a wonderful  beach about 2 miles from Tangalle , can swim from the beach only drawback no toilet !

Absolutely my favourite beach I visited in Sri Lanka. We were there in low season so the bars were really nice and quiet and we had the pick of the sun beds. You can rent body boards, wander round to the next bay, and just chill on the white sand. It can be quite rough, but it gets deep slowly, so it's fine for a dip.

The beach is nice and the water is reasonably calm in comparison to other places in SL. I would avoid the first restaurant on the beach, seen into the kitchen and it's disgusting. There is another restaurant a little further up

Goyambokka beach is the best beach in Tangalle area. I stayed at Green Garden Cabanas. From there to the beach is just 1 minute. So we enjoyed our holidays at Green Garden Cabanas and Goyambokka beach. Lovely beach and marvellous hotel. If you go to tangalle don't forget to stay at Green Garden Cabanas and go to Goyambokka beach.

One of the nicest beaches we have been to. Yellow soft sand, plenty of shade in afternoon and sea v inviting. Little bit of surf to swim in, some currents, but safe enough. We had food from the hut in the middle of the beach and fish was unexpectedly good! Chips were waaaaay to salty but fish was fresh and well cooked.
Even if you can't swim in tangalle beach here you can find a calm sea and a nice cocktail to relax....

This was the best beach I came across in Sri Lanka- very quiet and not a lot of locals hanging out to stare so I felt comfortable wearing a bikini. The plus was Eden Reverie which was a massage hut on the beach run by a lovely couple, it was probably the best massage I've ever had!

We Were visited goyambokka beach it is a nice beach and natural swimming pool like that. We took sunbed with umbrella sea face caf√© "" gereetje beach restaurant ""that place very good. Further delicious food  and grade service.you will go and be happy
a lovely cute beach, sheltered from the wind yet not too busy, very close to the anantarra hotel, so a good day trip from there
""Delicious sea food"" "Greetje beach restaurant" Goyambokka beach Sun bed (lie low )free take a food or drinks friendly staff  clean and verry beautiful place
It is a nice place to chill and spent some time there. I think it depends much on the season you travel!

We visited here on our way back to Tangalle after visiting some other nearby attractions. The beach is nice and clean but it is quite narrow and quite small. The coastline here is rocky and picturesque and we walked along to the nearby bays which were deserted. For us it didn't quite live up to the expectations from other reviews we had read.
Goyambokka beach is a small hidden pearl protected by rocks on both sides. There are even some small beach bars and eateries with yummy food.

GOYAMBOKKA is a bit rocky for swimming but on the plus side there are many rockpool around which you can see crabs, see urchins and fish in. There's some nice sunbeds avaliable right on the beach but we opted for the wooden sunlounger on the waters edge, There's also a lookout post you can climb up that gives you great views out over the beach. We spent a whole afternoon here and saw a handful of people. Theres so good restaurants along the beach too.

Very nice beach hidden in little village Tangalle. Not crowded. You can enjoy the food from local little restaurant on the beach and if you are lucky you can also observe the big turtles...Nice and quiet place. In april you can have fun in very big vawes

Very nice beach, far from the road. Many deck chairs available (cheap). We had lunch at the beach bar and the food was very good and the owner very kind. We took some baths at the sea, that was very calm.

Very crowded beach with tons of families. The rocks were cool and the palm trees provided the perfect amount of shade, but if you want something more privet - I recommend Medaketiya and Medilla for pristine empty beaches that stretch for miles.

We were told that the tangalle beaches are beaugtiful but that the sea was almost always to rough to swim. However Goyambokka beach proved this wasn't true. The beach is a positioned in a lovely cove sheltered by large rocky headlands either side. Although there were big waves, they broke further out and there was a wide calm shallow area that stretched a good 50 meters out to sea. This provided excellent paddling and warm swimming.

Small, beautifull and mostly safe for swimming even for children. But you should watch for waves and wind. When they begin to grow get the children off the ocean. About 3-4 fish "restaurants" (hovel in reality) here with same prices and without electricity and water supply, poor menu (no rice as garnish - only potato chips), good fish. Also the owner of the restaurant in the middle sometimes very angry and shouts at the visitors of the beach. But the beach is superb and wonderfull all the time for both laying on the send or swimming in the water.

Beautiful cristal clear beach.nice safe place to swim and body surfing. Good place to enjoy with kids. They can make sand castles. Day tours to wale watching, yala udawalawa safari and bird watching in bundala can go easily. Dont go with hotel arrangement tour guides. ?They are more costly.some times not well experience. There is freelance tour operator available on the beach. He organise well planned nice tours. Dont pay your money to brokers in the hotel reception.
World class beach and clean. Cafe could do with some lessons on customer service and how to make a sandwich. If you want to charge then at least make an effort to get it right.
the best beach in sri lanka! i was there and there were only 10 people with me at the same time! you can feel your privacy there. paradise!

This is a white sand beach with some beach hut restaurants. You can rent sun beds or just consume some food and get it for free. There is a lot of natural shadow. The sea is clean and you can bath and swim.

We have been in Sri Lanka for a week now and have been having had an exquisite time. Welcoming people, awe inspiring landscapes, clean and cosy lodgings. That was until last night. We hadn't realised the new year celebrations were going to last a week. So for the past few days we have had some issues with getting around (no buses) and with ordering food (limited options). No biggie. Last night we had planned to visit Break Point Restaurant but alas it was not operating. As we had had a fabulous lunch of grilled prawns and the best chips we've had in Sri Lanka by and large we decided to go back to the shack on the beach. The shack appears to be operating under the name Bamboo (that's what's written on the menus) and is the first one on Goyambokka beach if you're walking from rocky point beach. It's the last one if you're walking from Anantara, Palm Paradise or that direction. As my lunch there had been delicious (my friend's vegetable roti was sub par but we decided we'd stick to seafood) we went back for dinner. It hadn't opened yet and we saw one restaurant further down had opened so we decided to go there for an appetizer. We got grilled lobster with chips and a couple beers. Delicious. The guys there were adorable.  We should have stayed there. But we wanted to have a different vantage point and shift places for fun. As we walked to Bamboo, which had lit lanterns, we noticed there was no one there. So we started walking back, when we were hailed by a dude saying he was the owner of Bamboo and we could have dinner. I sensed something was amiss but we decided to sit down anyway. When he came to take out order it was clear he was drunk and had been partying all day. That's fine but then why come open your shack? Just stay out partying. Our order appeared too confusing for him so we settled for  ginger beers and a bottle of water. He asked repeatedly if he could sit down with us. Not being comfortable nor in the mood to be chatted up by a drunk stranger we politely but firmly refused. He would have none of it and sat down anyway, bringing with him a bottle of Arrack. He offered a drink of this and when I asked for the price he said it was "no charge". Obviously I wasn't going to accept free drinks so I offered 500 for a glass. Anyway the problem wasn't money. The problem was this dude's being upset by us refusing to chat with him. We decided to cut our stay short and go back to our hotel. The dude followed us on the beach and we found him quite menacing. In the end my friend gave him an extra 1000 rupees and he finally left us alone.
Save for children however not good for small children  and great swimming some time there are rough waves

We were advised to stay here by a local resident as it is safe for swimming (one of the few 'safe' beaches in Tangalle). But be warned, the waves are quite big throughout the day, and somewhat intimidating for small children and inexperienced swimmers. The beach restaurants here are not good - slow service, poor quality and rip off prices. If you want calmer beaches for swimming, best to head west to Weligama.

This is a beautiful beach with a calm sea for swimming. There are a few cafes with sunbeds and umbrellas - you just need buy a drink/snacks from them. It was peaceful and not too crowded, the only downside was there didn't seem to be any toilets but we only spent a couple of hours there so didn't matter to us.

Rough waves - not good for small children. We enjoyed walking next to the beach every day, watching the fishermen, the palmtrees, the wild ocean and big waves. But swimming in the ocean is not the best if you are travelling with small children. Even for adults, it can be a little trying with the big strong waves. My suggestion is to book a hotel with a swimming pool, such as the Villa Tangalle Lagoon, which is a great place next to the river and close to the beach as well.

this is an amazing beach, lovely sand and fun waves to play in. Unfortunately the only time I've had a disagreement in our whole stay in Sri Lanka was here. When we arrived we were offered a deck chair in the shade if we bought lunch at the mans restaurant, or if we didn't buy we would pay a fee. We agreed, taking deck chairs under a dodgy umbrella that was more frame than coconut leaf but within half an hour this was under cover of a tree so this was fine. We bought a few drinks and had a nice morning, but when we were ready for lunch the restaurant tables were full. And on closer inspection all the tables seemed to be sharing one plate, and no one looked happy to be there. So we decided to go elsewhere. The owner then demanded 1500 rupees as we weren't buying lunch, which we had not agreed to but appreciate our fault in not agreeing a fee at the beginning. After an unpleasant chat, pointing out that we had bought drinks and he had no free tables, I gave him 300 rupees, which he ripped up. We walked off, he ran after us but luckily we were staying at a place very nearby. TLDR: Lovely beach, agree a fee and check the food/menu before using deck chairs. And avoid the middle restaurant as no one seemed happy to be there. (Hint to the owner, a good business has happy customers, not just ones that are forced to eat there)

The beach itself is very beautiful. The problem are the amenities. There is no shower, only in the beach hotels, but that's obviously not available for non-residents. The chairs/beds are ridiculously overpriced (either you pay LKR 1500 or you have to have a seafood dish in a small restaurant and use the beds for "free"afterwards). Either way, you are not getting out of this without paying at least a thousand.
We had a wonderful stay at Goyambokka. The beach is safe and perfect for a family or love escape. Lovely cafes to have a king coconut juice or seafood lunch.

It is a lovely beach, there are some places to grab a beer and some food. There are also some sun beds and umbrellas for use. We were offered sunbeds from one place and the chap said if we bought lunch we could use the sunbeds for free. I was really suffering at that point from a bad stomach but he didn't really understand. In the end we just rested on the lovely sand instead until I had to leave before I started throwing up. This did affect my experience of the beach and on the whole I prefer quieter beaches, however it was perfectly nice spot for the day

This is a really beautiful beach, with fine sand and some big waves. There are a few beachside restaurants to enjoy a beer, or a coconut. Facing the water, you can also carry on around the headland to another quieter beach
Popular beach with big waves for body surfing. White sand, clean. Enjoy some seafood from a beach Cafe. Enjoyable!
It's a little quiet beach with an expensive beach restaurant for fruits and juices . waves are fun and you can rent a beach bed . also there is a good small cabana for massages !

On looking for a spot to lunch we bumped on this small strip of beach surrounded by rocks and palms. The food served at the stalls seems overpriced, but the setting and view is cut out of a commercial. Ideal for a cocktail, relaxing and a short swim.

This has woderfull bays and pure white sand beaches and crystal clear beaches. Nice bue water will give your ultimate relax in the beach. Visitors should be warned of one important factor. They should allways obtained service by  professional guide. Most tours arranged by hotel employed driver. They only know about driving. Where you go for professional guide following advantages there Climate/natural park/flora fuana/historical facts/nice explaination
This beach is quit small, so many people there, but nice. Close to this beach is much more beautiful Silent beach.

Great get away from the mainstream beaches where there are hordes of people. Surf is big, but manageable, and if you are. Boogie board fan, perfect for this.  Several little local. Each restaurants, all serve fresh fish right on the beach. A great way to have a quiet day, and yet play in some big waves.

This is a beautiful little bay. Where you can sunloungers, eat and swim. Great place to chill. Not very busy as it's a bit of the main road. There are two restaurants where you can it and drink and plenty of shady sunloungers.
This beach was right in front of our hotel area, clean, quiet, not too many people and good king coconuts you can buy to refresh. The waves are big, so do not swim too far ;)

The beach itself is very nice but it's too crowded. Umbrellas and tourists. Also the beach bars and restaurants are SUPER overpriced! The most expensive prices I've seen during my travels. Better to walk to a beach nearby where you can relax with almost no-one around.
Nice beach, but crowdy. Silent beach close to this one is much better! There are some places around to eat or drink but prices are higher than should be.
The beaches are stunning. There are several different beaches. All of them are lovely, idyllic beaches. Paradise!!!!!
We saw a couple of turtles here. Unfortunately, the water of the sea was not very clean but it is worth visiting.

We took a tuktuk from Tangalle City to Goyambokka Beach for 200 rupees. The beach is very nice with lots of sunbeds and parasols. There are a few beachcaf√©s. The beach almost seems like a private beach which makes it more attractive to me. Very clean and the water was so lovely and beautiful. The waves usually gets bigger during the day but for me, it was kind of fun! I liked this beach better than the one in the city. Wild dogs are running around the beach but they're doing no harm to the people.

This small beach is easy to access.There are lots of places to stay in the area behind the beach.Its pretty safe for swimming and body boarding,but no good for surfing(at least not whilst we were there).There are some great restaurants in the area too.

Nice small strip of beach almost a private beach sort of with 4 beach restaurants operated by locals around the area. Walking distance from hotel anantara and directly in front of palm paradise cabanas/villas. If you want to try surf boardschool it is a good place. Also try out beaches around Arugambay/pasikudha in eastern coast of Sri Lanka which are fantastic.

Located 100m south of Matara Road, it's very easy to reach with a pleasant walk (45 minutes) from Tangalle. A wonderful beach with clean yellow sand and turquoise water (be careful of high waves!). Umbrella and sea beds available on site: rental is free if you have lunch there (Phoenix restaurant is strongly recommended!)
Very beautiful small beach, but not much to do apart from sunbathing. Very big waves and strong currents. Beachrestaurants expensive and not very cosy.

My husband and I spent about four hours here and liked it. It's not a huge beach but good enough for a fun swim in the waves! We were told that we had to pay to rent the sun beds, or they would be free if we had something to eat. We came in around lunch time so we decided to have some seafood rice after our swim. The waves were a lot of fun and not as dangerous as a lot of other areas! We got to rent boogie boards (300 rupees an hour) and had an awesome time!
The best beach in tangalle. Quiet beach with nice restaurants. Perfect for families and couples. The sea is really clean
beautiful beach with confortable sea beds, nice stuff, fresh sea food, delicious taste, but small serving for price, which is quite expensive.
We definitely made the right choice, this beach is lovely and the Peacock Garden Cabanas are a fabulous place to stay while you're there. Be sure to have dinner on the beach by candlelight!
Best beach in Tangalle by miles. Great for swimming and sunbathing and relaxed eating on the beach. Not good for snorkelling.
A paradise. A wonderful place to see if you like to enjoy a beach with palms, sand, sun and few people.

We spent a few days near hear and enjoyed this beach a lot, although it can get quite busy. The waves are great for playing in although might be a bit strong for small children. They also have boogie boards you can borrow at the cafes which were great fun.

We came here for a massage and wanted to spend the rest of this day at a beach. Too many touists at this beach, food was the worst I have eaten so far in Sri Lanka and it was a bit expensive, big waves. There are 4 small restaurants at this small beach. Maybe if there are less people, I would visit this beach again.
Good for relaxing and for having fun with waves. There are few bars and restaurants. It is nice but it is definitely overrated, after half a day you will probably get bored.

When we arrived at the beach, they wanted 300 rupees for two sun beds, if we bought lunch. After a while they came with the menu and there was nothing that looked good, so we just wanted to pay for the sun beds. All off the sudden, the price had rise to 1500 rupees for the same two beds. We just left and will never come back to this hustler place. There is a lot nicer or similar beaches we would choose instead.

We loved the beach at Goyambokke.   It's not to busy and the sea was nice and warm. There are several little restaurants serving sea food and we had lunch in the one on the middle of the beach. The owner/chef speaks excellent English and sends his guys out to get whatever you want ... Lobsters prawns etc. It was my wife's birthday so we arranged to come back in the evening and he organized lobsters a bottle of wine we requested and we had the most amazing supper on our own private beach with our own private chef .... Delicious and an awesome experience that is hard to find in this overcrowded world of ours. His place is the one under the big palm trees on the centre of the beach her has four tables in the front row of tables and some loungers in front and boogie boards for hire

Small beach not far from main road, surrounded by chalets and resorts.  Sandy, rocks at both ends. Beach umbrellas provide shade, 4 or 5 places to get lunch or drinks. We went on a windy day so big waves.  Water not cold.  Also went in high season and beach not crowded so we worth a visit
Small beach but has got good waters if you want to jump at some waves. Avoid the food is possible. Expensive and awful food.

The beach is only quite short, but there's also very few people, so it doesn't matter. There are 4 separate bars on the beach, each with a set of umbrellas for renting. They don't charge anything for renting if you buy from the bar. There's nothing better - just take one of the umbrellas, and drink young coconut water. They're all reasonably priced, drinks at 100-200 ruppies (100 for coconut) and food for 400-1000, 1000 being a fresh grilled fish. Nobody is pushy, there're few solicitors, but they just let you be if you only shake your head. The waves were high enough for having really good fun (for an inland guy who sees a sea once per year maximum :) ), yet not too high so you could not swim there. There are no surfers on this beach and you can borrow those short boards for swimming from one of the bars. Overall, we spent 3 days on this beach and it was a really nice experience.
It is a truly blissful beach with stunning sand and kept really clean. The under current is a big strong but the sea is so lovely and warm.

Great beach for swimming and body surfing.  beach is clean of rubbish and there are 2-3 discrete bars/cafes. Local tuk tuk drivers try and run a cartel to keep prices high for foreigners.  Call Said for tuk tuk services at very reasonable/local rates Said mobile +94 77967 9204 local call 0779679204

Goyambokkah beach is a small secluded beach in Tangalla. Calm swimmable waters with some waves that will sometime carry you back to the beach (fun). One of the more charming aspects of the beach is that it is not crowded and just barely developed. The beach is unspoilt and the few shacks that serve food do it well to humane prices (try the grilled fish for an unexpected amazing taste experience). A great place to catch some sun and play in the water.

This is a beautiful beach,but sadly you can only paddle as its not really suitable for swimming due to the currents and waves.But to sit in a bar or restaurant and take in the view is just the job.You cant have everything but the view is great.

Bamboo is the most recent of the four snack shacks located on the beach. Please give my regards to Nuwan and Mahesh the owners/staff. The food was fresh and awesome. In addition to the lunch and drinks during the day they can provide a fantastic dinner as well if requested. All 4 of the Snack shacks on Goyambokka beach provide a great lunch and drinks.
the beach looks nice but the same you could say about all tangalla and dickwella beaches. we were in November and it was impossible to swim due to huge waves. t

nice beach, we went there in the morning and it was empty! lovely and clean. there are sun umbrellas avalaible. on one side of the beach there's a huge resort with watchmen. it was not easy to find the access road
Great beach almost out of a tropical postcard. Couple nice restaurants but slightly busy beach compared to the nearby ones, worth the visit. Well recommended!
great beach but the surf was really strong, the beach is pretty small but very pretty, we ate at a week old place " bamboos" the food was excellent quality, worth a visit

Goyambokka Beach is super beautiful and far away enough from the main tourism strip to be too crowded. And the best is the Eden Reverie Spa just at the beach! It is the best massage you can get in Sri Lanka and for such a reasonable price. Don't miss it!

Nice beach near to Tangalle hidden in the palm trees. Beatiful view to the ocean, in sunny day without big waves water is crystal clean. There are many sunbeds at the beach, most of them hidden under umbrellas. You can use them if you will buy some drinks or lunch in local bars. When we visited this place there is no garbage on the beach. But still many dogs right there (they are not aggressive).
Probably the best place to choose for swimming in Tangalle.Not many people, good waves.There a few restaurants as well.

A small beach with not many people, the sea is very clean and the waves sometimes high. It is possible to lie on the beds with umbrellas and they are for free in case you take a lunch in the local restaurant.
We went to a restaurant there (the one at the right end) and had fresh Lobster, which was really good!!! The small beach is very calm, not many people around, good for relaxing.

We were underwhelmed by tangalle in general but luckily we found this place which restored our faith. You can get a tuktuk for 200rps from tangalle. The beach is small, very beautiful and much nicer waves. Highly recommended.

First place we have been to where they charge you for sun loungers... despite us buying plenty of drinks. The beach is mediocre, the reviews we have read do exaggerate a tad. We have found much more beautiful and serene beach during our time in Sri Lanka.

We learnt of this little hidden beach after asking our tuk tuk driver to recommend a good beach and we were not dissapointed! As with most of Sri Lanka the walk to it was slightly littered but once you reach the beach it's a lovely cove, when we were there in October there was only one beach hut that served food and drink and they allow you to use the beds for free if you buy your lunch there which I recommend the White fish and salad... The best dish I ate in Sri Lanka!! The water is also perfect if you fancy some body boarding, the restaurant had 3 body boards that they let us use for free. The waves are best suited for fairly strong swimmers as the current can be quite strong. Definitely worth a visit :)

i have been this place several time with my family . such a nice beach white sandy . November  to  aprill is best time for swimming. there is hotel called palm pardise cabana is near by to have you food requirement  .

Really surprised by others reviews! Although we visited I. Low season the beach was not up to the previous reviews. Very dirty with lots of washed up litter, no sun lounges or parasols like the photos suggest, very small cove with building work on huts etc on the beach. Sandbags piled up in many places. Lots of stray dogs. Other beaches are much nicer.

The beach is indeed beautiful. It is not big and not crowded. There are 3 small cafes..we were visiting the one on the very right (looking at the ocean) and the food was very good there (try calamari with salad). There is a very nice SPA on the very left of the beach (really recommend you!). However, there 2 bad points: the waves are too big to swim and there is no sun after lunch (it hides behind the trees).

But you must go to the restaurant in the middle of the beach - cant vouch for the other two  - ask for evening meal reservation - he doesnt have electricity so by candlelight only- magical location, lovely food, best caring service
We spent 2 whole days just swimming and lying about on Goyambokka Beach. Beach beds, shade and food provided by commercial beach operators for a good price.
One of the most beautiful beach in Sri Lanka. I was there in March. There were a big waves without people. You can also find many kinds of bars and restaurants.
pristine and clean beach situated in tangalle. quiet beach to your self with hardly any one pestering you and lovely waves.

This beach has crystal clear bluish water and snowy bubbles appearing here like a velvet in blue cloth. This is near by tangalle town and  covered with palm trees like small beach forest. This beach sorrund by small rockey hills and you will feel ultimate relaxation there. Good and safe beach even for small kids. They can do body surfing here. Mosticonic thing here is you can watch how sea eagles  catch fish for their food. It is amazing. Small beach resturents and luxurious resorts are available here. Fresh sea food dishes are avilable in 10 $ onwards and rooms available 50 $ onwards.

Lovely beach for walking, with lots of fishing boats to look. Waves are medium, so it was nice to swim, I didn't feel threatend by them :) The whole atmosphere there was beautiful, with really beautiful deck-chairs and beach umbrellas.

amazing massage shack on beach with a lovely lady massurist who really knew her stuff- try it. Also 3 cafes which did amazing fish dishes. Go round the corner to the left and find a wonderful cafe on three levels-need to climb a ladder though.

Our favourite beach in Tangalle. Nice to swim, beautiful warm, crystal clear blue water. A row of beach bungalows that will feed you and ensure that you are well hydrated. If you eat at a bungalow, you get to use their loungers and umbrellas for the day. Well worth it.
Great sandy beach and good for swimming if you like waves. Go to the middle beach bar which is on stilts. The others are terrible with uninterested staff.
Small beach near Tangalle good for swimming.Medium sized waves .There are few restaurants and one spa in the area but i didnt tried their quality.

Best restaurant and bar is Krishans its the one on stilts in the middle of the beach. Sun loungers are free if you have lunch (not just chips) try the prawns in garlic butter or the squid flash fried in garlic butter. If there's anything special you want just ask him he will get it for you.

Think Place is a small family run restaurant with a man mad tree house / tower and a handful of tables but the best curried fried fish I've had in Sri Lanka. Its just to the right of the (main goyumboka beach opposite Palm Paradise cabanas. ) pass the three beach cafes on that beach and then you have to climb over some rocks on the right hand side of beach and you discover a smaller second beach were Think Place is hiding. Great food but maybe go round in the morning / day before and reserve a slot in the tree house for lunch - one dish only but what a dish and setting !!
It's a nice little beach with a few restaurants. At the time I was there it was safe to swim, no particular current. It's a clean, intimate beach, perfectly fine to spend a lazy afternoon

It was quite difficult for us to swim in the beach on Tangalle, so discovering Goyambokka Beach was a GEM! You can just visit any  small drink and food shack on the beach and order a nice ginger beer and coconut before jumping into the calm AMAZING sea. This beach is amazing for swimming, body surfing and body boarding. A lot of tourists in the area, but everyone's relaxed and peaceful which is wonderful.

This small beach is home to four beach caf√©s whose sunbeds take up practicallyy all of the available sand area above high tide. Great for those who love sunbeds but not so good for those who prefer a quiet beach. Bathing popular but watch out for the big waves. Accessed by bus (Rs10) or Tuk-Tuk (Rs200) from Tangalla.  Look for fireflies and giant bats at night when the beach is quiet.
Lovely long beach for walking on with lots of fishing boats to look as as you wander along.  Did not swim as it was a bit rough when we were there.

Hi, to everyone who enjoy Goyambokka beach. Yes, this is a gem for most travelers to sri lanka. I really enjoyed this place. But,,,,,,, 10 years before, it was pure sandy beach that you could genuinely say private, but now it is full of beach restaurants or cafes and private beach beds. I advice every traveler who enjoy this beach and want to preserve it for the future, please please don't use those beach sacks. Every year it becomes more and more beach restaurants. As long as you are visiting them, there will be more next year. So. one day or sooner, you will not more enjoy the privacy of the beach, but busy dirty, crowded beach. Do you want that, are you really interested in preserving this beach for  the future, please do not visit them, but ask for your guest house or hotel to prepare a packet of snack or juice for you. That will definitely help preserve this gem in future. Thank you.

This beach is quite secluded but defo not undiscovered. Despite quite a lot of visitors it remains to be a tranquil place for relaxing and swimming. Nice massage place directly on the beach. Rs. 2.800 for 60 minutes full body.
It's a 4km walk or tuk tuk ride from Tangalle and worth it. A nice secluded beach with a few bars/eateries and great beach for swimming.
Quite small beach with palms and a few beach restaurants. Defintely nicer than than Mirissa and a better place for swimming.
Liked fact you can swim - nice places to eat - a bit touristy for me.Good choice of accommodation - we had good lunch here.Upmarket prices.
lovely little bay with small restaurants with good fresh food. Good for any sort of wave riding and walks.

We stayed in Tangelle and just caught a tuk-tuk to Goyambokka Beach for 200LKR. It is just beautiful with the golden sand, palm trees and a really good swimming beach. There are a couple of places where you can grab a cool drink and something to eat. It is a small beach but still a bit undiscovered not like Unawatuna etc. you can easily spend a whole day just lying in the sun and swimming here.
Small but very nice and swimmable beach with some few restaurants/bars run by some very friendly guys.

Goyambokka is a lovely beach with 3 rustic beach bars serving food and drinks. They all offer free sun beds (although they expect you to buy something from the bar) they aren't pushy though and one day we just bought bottled water. The water is choppy but nowhere near as bad as we were expecting and you can still go for a swim. All in all a lovely beach however I worry when the complex next door to Palm Paradise is complete it may get ruined so go now whilst you can. There's only a handful of people on the beach at any one time so it's really nice and there's no 'lucky lucky' men either which was a relief. There is one guy walking up and down touting tours (don't buy from him, he's ridiculously overpriced).

We pretty much had this gorgeous beach to ourselves.  There's good surf (I don't think for actual surfing as the waves all run into each other randomly) and you walk over into the next little cove which is also paradise.  There's a little place that serves juices too- Manith's makes a good papaya one.
We found this beach after having lunch at Green Cabanas Hotel and couldn't recommend it more highly.  There were big exciting waves and there was hardly anybody around.
A small perfectly formed cove with 2 beach cafes, golden sand and very rough sea. The beach is very nice indeed, backed by palm trees and very little development.

Sand not white, construction debris and junk at entrance not v appealing, waves come up high with only a small strip for sunbathing but water seems clean though shallow with a strong receding tow Did not use the beach shack so cannot comment.

Beach is ok, although we didn't like the stray dogs roaming around, quite hard to get to but the worst beach shack ever is on the left hand side as you stand and look out to sea. The prices were expensive and we couldn't even get a decent sun bed....we were given 3 broken beds then had quite a heated debate over the ridiculous charge for a bed -it was agreed before hand then when we went to pay for our drinks the group of men running the shack tried to make us pay an extra 1000 rupees. The beach is fun and the waves are very strong-it actually snapped our daughters boogie board. Not a pleasant experience overall.
A perfect little beach with a few restaurants that also have sunbeds and umbrellas. In July there are big waves but swimming was very good possible. At beach restarant Greetje you even have wifi!

When we got there we tried to get down the rocks with the stroller and no one from the restaurant helped, while we were struggling down the rocks young lads who own the place were not doing anything just lounging about watching us! Also when we got down the rocks we wanted some sun beds and the note said if u had lunch here u get the beds free so we agreed with a person from the restaurant if we have some drinks here we get to have the beds, but when we were leaving and paying for the drinks another guy said u have to pay for the beds which were 1000 rupees for one bed! But then we spoke up and said hang on we agreed if we have the drinks we get the beds but then he said no and kept insisting us to pay so we left without paying!!  :)

First thing that struck me was the big waves, they are pretty high for new traveller to theese island oceans. Second thing that I noticed was the guy that owns the bar to the far left (from the beach).  He really wanted to sell a lot of things all the time! Trying to be "friends", kind of annoying.. there were piles of plastic, and thrash on the edges of the beach. Sun is only shining during morning/midday. If you meet a guy namned Sri, let him be your guide. He was GREAT!

Lovely little bay of white sand, but the waves were VERY big and rough in July. You couldn't really swim in the sea. The caf√©s on the beach are quite poor, shabby and overpriced, also bad service and kept forgetting anything we ordered. Loungers are available free but only if you buy something from the caf√©s.
great white calm beach if you want to get away from the crowd, great small restaurants on the beach.
It was calm, with not so high waves, ideal to rest and sunbath. There are two bars located on the beach, but the prices are quite high.
